intro: Parosela carthagenensis, commonly known as the Carthage parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Parosela carthagenensis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
